bio.bio: Artist and developer. He started in the late 90s as a composer of electronic and concrete music. His work is deeply intertwined with algorithmic processes and concepts.
bio.bio2: In the mid-2000s, he began to investigate programming languages ​​and apply algorithmic techniques in computer music and computer graphics, developing a series of experimental audiovisual pieces.
bio.bio3: His current thincking process is strongly attached to a number of (not only) computacional concepts such as generativity, noise, finite state machines, fractals and algebraic processes; and some others more meta-structural ones like modularity and hybridization in complex systems (digital-analog, man-machines) and networks.  He is also interested in live-coding and improvisation.
bio.bio4: His works include musical compositions, electronic audiovisuals performances, installations, videoart and apps, among others.
bio.bio5: His works include musical compositions, electronic audiovisuals performances, installations, videoart and apps, among others.
